description: Borrowed from French sommelier (“originally, a person in charge of the beasts of burden carrying wine”), from somme (“pack”) +‎ -ier (suffix forming the names of jobs).  somme is from Vulgar Latin *sauma, from Latin sagma (“packsaddle”).

entries.meaning: The member of staff at a restaurant who keeps the wine cellar and advises the guests on a choice of wines; a wine steward / stewardess, a wine waiter / waitress / server.
examples: The sommelier recommended the perfect wine, opened the bottle with panache, and served it into glasses.

verbs.description: sommelier (third-person singular simple present sommeliers, present participle sommeliering, simple past and past participle sommeliered)
